FIELD_DESC: An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airline (carrier). A unique airline (carrier) is defined as one holding and reporting under the same DOT certificate regardless of its Code, Name, or holding company/corporation.

Unique Carrier Code. When the same code has been used by multiple carriers, a numeric suffix is used for earlier users, for example, PA, PA(1), PA(2). Use this field for analysis across a range of years.
Unique Carrier Name. When the same name has been used by multiple carriers, a numeric suffix is used for earlier users, for example, Air Caribbean, Air Caribbean (1).

Origin Airport, Airport ID. An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airport.  Use this field for airport analysis across a range of years because an airport can change its airport code and airport codes can be reused.
Number of Months that the Carrier Reported in the Quarter (1, 2, or 3)
